oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: American Eagle In Britain - 1945-mm-24 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Mutual Broadcasting System program American Eagle In Britain, broadcast in arrangement with the British Broadcasting Corporation. Possibly originally broadcast February 24, 1945 (unconfirmed, based on information on torn label and content on other side of disc). Featuring interviews conducted by Cecil Madden and Major Ken Treadwell on location at Dunker's Den of the American Red Cross Rainbow Corner Club in London, England; and Bebe Daniels on location at the 97th General Hospital, England. Features music by the Gremlins/Gremlin Orchestra, under the direction of Lieutenant George Puig (spelling unconfirmed), with conductor Sergeant Tom Frank.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Gremlins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer opening statement -- Opening statement (Cecil Madden) -- Servicemen introduce themselves -- Cecil Madden introduces Ken Treadwell -- Ken Treadwell talks with servicemen -- Cecil Madden introduces the Gremlins -- Nellie Gray (Gremlins) -- Ken Treadwell introduces members of the band and other servicemen -- Cecil Madden introduces Earl A. Trosclair -- Earl A. Trosclair talks -- Cecil Madden introduces Bebe Daniels -- Bebe Daniels interviews wounded servicemen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mutual Broadcasting System; BBC Radio; WSIX (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); American Eagle in Britain (Radio program); Treadwell, Ken; Madden, Cecil; Daniels, Bebe, 1901-1971
